QRP with your loading screen art tip:

When you're having trouble getting motivated to start try;

1 - Keeping your work area ready with everything you need before you even plan to start.
2 - Play something (vid/music) that's 10-20 minutes long, and work until it ends. Keep going if you feel like it

Heads up if you use a PC with Windows 11: recent updates have put "Copilot" on your computer! This is Microsoft's new AI and it is integral to your OS; you CANNOT delete it!

BUT! You can -disable- it. And since it spies on you, odds are you'll want to it! 

They don't make it easy, though.

Its been a quiet, gloomy morning. 
Angel keeps popping out to see if her sister is in the other room with me. And, disappointment, flies back to the bedroom.
I love Angel, but she was never a cuddly people-bird, she was Razz's friend first.
Still trying to be a companion to her the best I can.
I miss my baby girl, its barely been an hour
Razz is gone, I feel like my heart has been completely crushed. I love her so much. I can't even imagine how hard the first day without her is going to be
A night I've unfortunately gone through before but it's still horrible. She's such a good girl. Even now all she wants is to be held. And I'll hold her as long as I can

Razz had another stroke tonight. I can't afford another midnight ride to the emergency vet. They did all they could for her last time. Her meds unfortunately haven't seemed to help.
I love my Razz, I'm telling her over & over. I hope if she passes tonight its painless. I'm crushed I can't do more.

Friends! Here's how to remove ai from your google searches using the example; fantasy horse 

Fantasy horse, before:2023 
Brings up everything posted ONLY before the year 2023 

Fantasy horse, -ai -prompt -stock -openai 
Gets rid of MOST generative images and includes current/recent images

Everyone has been liking my mouse-themed artwork recently.
It reminded me of an old drawing of mine featuring some mice that I'm still pretty happy with.
From about 6-7 years ago.

It was a golden head with light brown stripes, the only chestnut-ish color was the wings. It really reminded me of a savannah sparrow but twice its size with more yellow, I love chipping sparrows though, such bright color.

That's what I thought and I checked some female and juvenile color patterns but its face was more yellow than that. We do have a small group of them in the complex nearby though, I see them lingering in the blackberries while the other birds go ham in the feeders

I found an unusual sparrow tonight while out with my binoculars. It was flying around with a song sparrow but the yellow on the face was different & caught my eye. I couldn't get a photo but drew what I remembered. If any fellow bird nerds want to help me out with an ID that would be awesome 🪶

This sticker thing has me so depressed and anxious. I would so much rather be able to go there face to face and Be a physical reminder that I am a person you owe money to, not overly polite text on a computer screen.

Due to this business taking advantage of my GFB relationship, going forward I will require all payments up front before goods are shipped out. 
I do encourage other small business artists not to make the same mistakes as me. Payment up front for merch, always. Especially with people you don't know.

My last ditch effort is going to be me insisting if they cannot afford to pay me at this time, I can send someone to collect my unpaid for materials from their shop & I can match the remainders to the invoice quantities so they only need to pay for what they sold. Then I could resell them elsewhere

While I have worked with this shop in the past, and been paid in a timely fashion from them, this is new management.
I would implement a late fee if I thought they would pay it but since they have not even paid any of the current invoice I doubt they would honor a late charge on top of what they owe

'Why didn't I charge them up front?'
I currently sell through three shops that I have good relationships with and they order on an as need basis and they pay within two days of getting their merch.
It was a Good Faith business plan that, as you can see, has bitten me on the ass.

Was the eye of the blackbird.
Rudeneja.

11 IDEAS FOR ENLIVENING A COMICS PAGE. Some pages will just lay there, not engaging you. And if you're not engaged, the reader won't be either. Let’s talk about ways to solve that problem as artists. 🧵

6 TAKE SOMETHING OUT You don't have to treat every panel like a window on a scene. Try vignetting the important stuff and letting the parts that aren't important fade into the white of the page. Early 20th century illustrators like Dean Cornwell were brilliant at this.

A friend just posted this list of mine on the other site for her comics students, so I thought I should post it here as well.

Thormundar - Ice-Encrusted Draugr

Just an old painting of a zombie bear; I like painting big and chunky rough-cut ice, alright?

Thormundar - Tavern Brawl

An old piece featuring my panda OC, Annikka; the background was inspired by a pub I visited back when I was in Seattle for a college exchange program. (Not the worried Roswell in the back though; that was just me being cheeky)

Thormundar - Exploring the Tomb

An old piece featuring my panda OC, Annikka; this one was an experiment in having the painting be mainly low-value, with a single light source. 

The statues in the piece were also a design I did back in 2014/2015, that I wanted to reuse for a future thing.
